lines.gurmukhi: krq n ieCw kCu imqR sqRq n jwnY bwl buiD suiD nwih bwlk Acyq kau
lines.transliteration_english: Karat N Ichhaa Kachhu Mitr Satrat N Jaanai , Baal Budhi Sudhi Naahi Baalak Achayt Kau ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Due to his childlike wisdom and unawareness of all sorts, a child is innocent, He desires nothing, nor does he harbour any hostility or friendship with anyone;

lines.gurmukhi: Asn bsn lIey mwqw pwCY lwgI folY bolY muK AMmiRq bcn suq hyq kau
lines.transliteration_english: Asan Basan Leeay Maataa Paachhai Laagee Dolai , Bolai Moukh Anmrit Bachan Sout Hayt Kau ?

Shabad OS B.translation: His mother out of love keeps wandering behind him with food and clothing and utters elixir-like loving words for her son;

lines.gurmukhi: bwlkY AsIs dYnhwrI Aiq ipAwrI lwgY gwir dYnhwrI bilhwrI fwrI syq kau
lines.transliteration_english: Baalakai Asees Dainahaaree Ati Piaaree Laagai , Gaari Dainahaaree Balihaaree Daaree Sayt Kau ?

Shabad OS B.translation: The mother loves her friends who keep showering blessings on her son but one who abuses him or say ill words for him destroys her peace of mind and creates duality.

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy gurisK smdrsI AnMdmeI jYso jgu mwnY qYso lwgY Plu Kyq kau ]393]
lines.transliteration_english: Taisay Gursikh Samadarasee Anandamaee , Jaiso Jagu Maanai Taiso Laagai Dhalu Khayt Kau ?393?

Shabad OS B.translation: Like the innocent child, the obedient Sikh of the Guru maintains impartiality. He treats all alike and by virtue of the relishing of the Naam Ras blessed by the True Guru, stays in a state of bliss. Whatever way is he recognised and known by the worldly p
